channel.title: slackroll package manager
channel.description: slackroll is a package or update manager for Slackware systems.

item.title: slackroll v46 released
item.description: This release restores duplicate package filtering for the "info" operation, which otherwise failed in some situations.

item.title: slackroll v45 released
item.description: This release removes an anti-feature that filtered theoretically duplicate packages during the install operation, preventing some packages in third-party mirrors from being selected and installed by the user.

item.title: slackroll v44 released
item.description: slackroll v44 has been released. This version fixes some documentation bugs and adds an option to get a shell to run arbitrary commands after kernel-related operations without exiting the program (similar to stopping the program with Ctrl+Z). In addition, while slackroll is still published to the public domain, the approach has changed from a mere public domain note to CC0, as recommended by the FSF and others, in order to increase legal safety.

item.title: slackroll v43 released
item.description: slackroll v43 has been released. This version adds support for external repositories. The introduction and tutorial has been updated and is a recommended read. slackroll veterans could simply read the "Remote trees" subsection and the "External repositories" subsection. Also, see the help for the "add-repo", "list-repos" and "remove-repo" operations.
